refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A recording surface is a surface that records all drawing operations at the highest level of the surface backend interface, (that is, the level of paint, mask, stroke, fill, and show_text_glyphs). The recording surface can then be "replayed" against any target surface by using it as a source surface.

A recording surface is logically unbounded, i.e. it has no implicit constraint on the size of the drawing surface. However, in practice this is rarely useful as you wish to replay against a particular target surface with known bounds. For this case, it is more efficient to specify the target extents to the recording surface upon creation.

The recording phase of the recording surface is careful to snapshot all necessary objects (paths, patterns, etc.), in order to achieve accurate replay. The efficiency of the recording surface could be improved by improving the implementation of snapshot for the various objects. For example, it would be nice to have a copy-on-write implementation for _cairo_surface_snapshot.

refsect2.title: CAIRO_HAS_RECORDING_SURFACE
refsect2.para: Defined if the recording surface backend is available. The recording surface backend is always built in. This macro was added for completeness in cairo 1.10.

refsect2.title: cairo_recording_surface_create ()
refsect2.para: Creates a recording-surface which can be used to record all drawing operations at the highest level (that is, the level of paint, mask, stroke, fill and show_text_glyphs). The recording surface can then be "replayed" against any target surface by using it as a source to drawing operations.
The recording phase of the recording surface is careful to snapshot all necessary objects (paths, patterns, etc.), in order to achieve accurate replay.

listitem.simpara: the content of the recording surface
the extents to record in pixels, can be NULL to record unbounded operations.
a pointer to the newly created surface. The caller owns the surface and should call cairo_surface_destroy() when done with it.

refsect2.title: cairo_recording_surface_ink_extents ()
refsect2.programlisting: void cairo_recording_surface_ink_extents (cairo_surface_t *surface, double *x0, double *y0, double *width, double *height);
refsect2.para: Measures the extents of the operations stored within the recording-surface. This is useful to compute the required size of an image surface (or equivalent) into which to replay the full sequence of drawing operations.

listitem.simpara: the x-coordinate of the top-left of the ink bounding box
the y-coordinate of the top-left of the ink bounding box
the width of the ink bounding box
the height of the ink bounding box
